page.title: 11LIFE ON THE DOLE
page.content: {*** A personal View by TICO TRIKIC *** The title of this look at unem- -ployment is not really appropriate. As someone unemployed, I do not live a LIFE, it is more like trying to exist on the small means available from the state. Life without work leaves a void which is very difficult to fill. Like most unemployed, I trained for a trade, which as well as work was a form of social life, which cannot be replaced by leisure time. Entertaining the children becomes very difficult. When employed we had a car and most weekends and holidays we went on trips (if only to Bradgate Park or the woods). Now we are rest- -ricted to local parks or the canal. A trip to the coast is an event which takes weeks of budgeting for. Facilit- -ies for the family unit of unemployed is very limited.
